channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 米国でTikTokを禁止しようとする動きが停滞している。全面禁止を求める国防当局者と、妥協案を支持する経済当局者が衝突しているからだ（Gavin Bade/Politico）
item.description:
Gavin Bade / Politico:
A look at the stalled efforts to ban TikTok in the US as defense officials, who want an outright ban, clash with economic officials who back a compromise  —  The administration is throwing its weight behind a new bill after previous legislative and national security efforts faltered.

item.title: 出典：2023年6月頃の時点で、ネットフリックスの広告売上と広告付き加入者数は、2023年における同社の当初社内予測の約半分だった（Sahil Patel/The Information）。
item.description:
Sahil Patel / The Information:
Source: as of about June 2023, Netflix's ad sales and ad-supported subscriber numbers were roughly half what the company initially projected internally for 2023  —  Turning Netflix into an advertising goliath is proving tougher than the video-streaming giant expected.

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙は、デジタル購読と広告の課題を相殺するため、今後数週間にわたり、2500人のうち〜240人の雇用削減を目指し、自発的なバイアウトを提案している（Katie Robertson/New York Times）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
The Washington Post is offering voluntary buyouts over the next few weeks, aiming to cut ~240 jobs out of 2,500 to offset digital subscription and ad challenges  —  The publication has struggled to grow subscriptions in recent years.  —  The Washington Post is cutting about 240 jobs across the company …

item.title: メモCondé Nast Entertainmentのアニエス・チュー社長は、編集、ブランド・コンテンツ、ビデオを統合した組織再編で、10月末に退任することが決まっている（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Memo: Condé Nast Entertainment President Agnes Chu is set to leave at the end of October in a reorganization combining editorial, branded content, and video  —  The executive joined the company from Disney in 2020.  —  Condé Nast is shaking up its video and editorial content structure …

item.title: イスラエルとハマスの戦争がエスカレートするなか、政府機関やメディアのウェブサイトを改ざんしたりDDoSを仕掛けたりする外部のハッカーを含む、双方のハクティビズムについて考察する（Wired）。
item.description:
Wired:
As the Israel-Hamas war escalates, a look at the hacktivism on both sides, including outside hackers defacing and DDoSing government websites and media outlets  —  Since the conflict escalated, hackers have targeted dozens of government websites and media outlets with defacements and DDoS attacks …

item.title: メモワシントン・ポスト紙は今後数週間以内に「希望退職」パッケージを提供し、全社で〜240人の人員削減を目指す（Ben Mullin/@benmullin）
item.description:
Ben Mullin / @benmullin:
Memo: The Washington Post is offering “voluntary separation” packages in the next few weeks, aiming to reduce its workforce by ~240 people across the company  —  Inbox: Washington Post is reducing its workforce by approximately 240 positions [image]

item.title: 情報筋メール・オン・サンデー紙がマイク・リチャーズ、ロブ・ドレイパーら上級スポーツ記者4人を解雇、専属スポーツ編集者不在に（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
Sources: Mail on Sunday laid off four senior sports journalists, including Mike Richards and Rob Draper, leaving the newspaper without a dedicated sports editor  —  European Football Writer of the Year Rob Draper and BJA winner Nick Harris look set to leave.

item.title: アマゾンの「プライム大特価デー」に、ガネットの商品レビューサイトが交渉日を与えなかったため、レビュードの40人以上の組合員が1日ストライキを行った（Angela Fu/Poynter）
item.description:
Angela Fu / Poynter:
On Amazon's Prime Big Deals Day, 40+ unionized staff at Reviewed stage a one-day strike after the Gannett product reviews site didn't give them bargaining dates  —  Shopping holidays, like Amazon's Prime Days and Black Friday, are the product review site's biggest revenue drivers

item.title: エボニー・メディア・グループがライオンズゲートと提携し、サムスンTVプラス、ロク・チャンネル、Tubi、アマゾン・フリービーにFASTチャンネル「Ebony TV by Lionsgate」を開設（BreAnna Bell/Variety）
item.description:
BreAnna Bell / Variety:
Ebony Media Group partners with Lionsgate to launch Ebony TV by Lionsgate, a FAST channel coming to Samsung TV Plus, The Roku Channel, Tubi, and Amazon Freevee  —  Ebony Media Group, the company behind Ebony Magazine, has teamed up with Lionsgate to announce the launch of their joint venture, Ebony TV by Lionsgate.

item.title: クリエイターのオンライン動画ビジネスの成長を支援する新興企業Jellysmackが、ダン・エイブラムスの実録動画・制作会社Law&Crime Networkを買収（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Jellysmack, a startup that helps creators grow their online video business, acquires Dan Abrams' true-crime video and production company, Law&Crime Network  —  Jellysmack has acquired Law&Crime Network, the legal and true-crime video network and production company headed by Dan Abrams.

item.title: パラマウント・グローバルとiSpot.tvが提携、パラマウントの米国メディアとストリーミングプロパティでiSpotの指標を使った全米テレビ広告キャンペーンの「測定と取引」を行う（Wayne Friedman/MediaPost）
item.description:
Wayne Friedman / MediaPost:
Paramount Global and iSpot.tv partner to “measure and transact” national TV ad campaigns using iSpot metrics for Paramount's US media and streaming properties  —  Deepening more alternative-currency agreements among major TV network-based media companies, Paramount Global has struck …

item.title: 独占：JellysmackがLaw&Crime Networkを買収（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Exclusive: Jellysmack acquires Law&Crime Network  —  Jellysmack, a startup that helps creators grow their online video businesses, is acquiring Law&Crime, the true crime and legal drama media company founded by legal analyst and entrepreneur Dan Abrams, Axios has learned.

item.title: アイマックスの株主が、アイマックスの上海にあるアイマックス・チャイナ部門の28.5％の株式のうち、同社がまだ所有していない株式を取得するために提案された1億2400万ドルの取引を否決（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Imax shareholders vote down a proposed $124M deal to acquire the 28.5% stake in Imax's Shanghai-based Imax China unit that the company does not already own  —  Plans to acquire a remaining 28.5 percent stake that Imax did not already own in the Shanghai-based unit failed to meet a threshold for investor approval.

item.title: ロンドンを拠点とするAudooは、公共の場で再生される音楽を識別し、印税のためのより正確なデータを収集するAudio Meterで、500万ドルを調達し、資金調達総額を2200万ドルに伸ばした（Stuart Dredge/Music Ally）
item.description:
Stuart Dredge / Music Ally:
London-based Audoo, whose Audio Meter identifies music played in public to gather more accurate data for royalties, raised $5M, taking its total funding to $22M  —  Can you feel the love tonight (well, this morning) for British startup Audoo?  It has raised a new $5m funding round led …

item.title: Xが公益ポリシーを変更：「知名度の高い」アカウントによる、規則に反したニュース価値のある投稿はアップし続けることができ、政府関係者に限定されなくなる（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
X changes its public interest policy: “high-profile” accounts' newsworthy posts defying its rules can stay up and are no longer limited to government officials  —  X, formerly Twitter, has changed its “Public interest expectations” policy to redefine what posts are newsworthy …
